sn11.20:4.4: “Once upon a time, mendicants, Sakka, Lord of Gods, addressed his charioteer Mātali:
sn11.20:4.5: ‘My dear Mātali, harness the chariot with its team of a thousand thoroughbreds. Let’s go to a park and see the nice scenery.’
sn11.20:4.6: ‘Yes, lord,’ replied Mātali. He harnessed the chariot and informed Sakka:
sn11.20:4.7: ‘Good sir, the chariot with its team of a thousand thoroughbreds has been harnessed. Please go when you’re ready.’
sn11.20:4.8: Then Sakka descended from the Palace of Victory, raised his cupped palms, and revered the mendicant Saṅgha.
sn11.20:4.9: So Mātali the charioteer addressed Sakka in verse:
